newProducts.title: Serena
newProducts.description: A powerful coding agent toolkit providing semantic retrieval and editing capabilities. Turns LLMs into fully-featured agents that work directly on codebases with IDE-like functionality. Supports 30+ programming languages through MCP server integration.

newProducts.title: Kilocode
newProducts.description: Open-source VS Code AI agent that generates code from natural language, automates tasks, and checks its own work. Supports 400+ models including Gemini 3 Pro and Claude 4 Sonnet with transparent pricing.

newProducts.title: CCPM
newProducts.description: Project management system for Claude Code using GitHub Issues and Git worktrees for parallel agent execution. Enables spec-driven development with full traceability from PRD to production, supporting context preservation and parallel execution.

newProducts.title: Crystal
newProducts.description: Desktop app that runs multiple Codex and Claude Code AI sessions in parallel git worktrees. Allows working on multiple tasks simultaneously instead of waiting for agents to finish by using AI on isolated code copies.

newProducts.title: vibe-log-cli
newProducts.description: CLI tool for logging and analyzing Claude Code and Cursor AI-driven coding sessions locally. Features include standup summaries, productivity reports, Claude Code statusline with strategic guidance, and privacy-preserving code sanitization.

newProducts.title: Memori
newProducts.description: Open-source memory engine for LLMs and AI agents that provides persistent memory capabilities for AI coding assistants and autonomous agents.

newProducts.title: ADK-Go
newProducts.description: Google's Go toolkit for building AI agents, providing comprehensive tools for developing autonomous coding agents and AI-powered development tools.

newProducts.title: LightRAG
newProducts.description: Simple and fast retrieval-augmented generation framework designed for AI coding applications, enabling efficient context retrieval for code generation and understanding tasks.

whitelistUpdates.title: Version 2.1 with Improved Plan Mode, AI Code Review, and Instant Grep
whitelistUpdates.description: Cursor released version 2.1 featuring Improved Plan Mode, AI Code Review in Editor, and Instant Grep capabilities. The company also announced it raised $2.3B Series D and passed $1B in annualized revenue.

whitelistUpdates.title: Version 1.0 Release
whitelistUpdates.description: Continue announced version 1.0 release, marking a major milestone for the open-source AI coding assistant. The announcement received coverage from TechCrunch and AP News.

whitelistUpdates.title: Continue Cloud Agents Productivity Update
whitelistUpdates.description: Continue released new blog post about Continue Cloud Agents increasing developer productivity, showcasing the platform's cloud-based AI agent capabilities.

whitelistUpdates.title: Version 2.0 with New Coding Model and Agent Interface
whitelistUpdates.description: Cursor released version 2.0 featuring a new coding model and agent interface, representing a significant update to the AI-powered IDE.

insights.title: Can Vibe Coding Beat Graduate CS Students? An LLM vs. Human Coding Tournament
insights.description: A comprehensive study comparing LLM-coded vs human-coded agents in strategic coding tasks. Key findings show humans clearly outperformed LLMs - top 5 spots all human-coded, 33 of 40 LLM agents lost to simple baselines, and even when given the best human solution to improve, the best LLM made it worse. The study used a logistics optimization problem requiring strategic bidding and routing across 12 tournaments with ~40k matches.
insights.author: Multiple Researchers

insights.title: SPAgent: Reducing Latency of LLM Search Agent via Speculation-based Algorithm-System Co-Design
insights.description: Introduces SPAgent, which uses a two-phase adaptive speculation mechanism and two-level scheduler to break serial execution in LLM search agents. Achieves up to 1.65Ã— speedup while maintaining or improving accuracy, representing a significant advance in making AI coding agents more responsive and efficient.
insights.author: Multiple Researchers

insights.title: RPM-MCTS: Knowledge-Retrieval as Process Reward Model with Monte Carlo Tree Search for Code Generation
insights.description: Novel approach using knowledge retrieval as a process reward model with Monte Carlo Tree Search for code generation. Evaluates intermediate algorithmic steps, removes redundant nodes through similarity filtering, and uses sandbox execution feedback for timely error correction. Outperforms state-of-the-art methods while reducing token consumption by approximately 15%.
insights.author: Multiple Researchers

insights.title: Gemini CLI Tips and Tricks for Agentic Coding
insights.description: Popular Hacker News discussion (169 points, 55 comments) about techniques for using Google's Gemini CLI in AI-assisted workflows. Suggests active community interest in practical applications of AI coding tools and sharing of productivity-enhancing techniques.
insights.author: Hacker News Community

insights.title: Claude Skills and Claude Code for Web
insights.description: Simon Willison's November posts highlight Claude Skills as potentially being 'a bigger deal than MCP' and Claude Code for Web as 'a new asynchronous coding agent from Anthropic.' These discussions focus on the evolving landscape of AI agent capabilities and development tools, with emphasis on agentic coding systems.
insights.author: Simon Willison

insights.title: Fara-7B: An efficient agentic model for computer use
insights.description: Microsoft's specialized LLM for automation tasks garnered attention on Hacker News (43 points, 13 comments), highlighting developer interest in efficient, specialized models designed specifically for agentic computer use and automation tasks.
insights.author: Microsoft Research

insights.title: NNGPT: Rethinking AutoML with Large Language Models
insights.description: Research paper proposing new approaches to AutoML systems leveraging LLMs, suggesting fundamental shifts in how automated machine learning systems can be designed and implemented using large language models.
insights.author: Multiple Researchers
